result.execSummary:
The defendant Glen P. Brockmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay $250.00 fine plus costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
------------------------------
Pursuant to sec. 973.046(1r), the defendant is required to pay $200.00 DNA surcharge.
Pay Sheriff's fees in the amount of $80.00.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Glen P. Brockmann

Victim's Request to Lift the No Contact

Defendant Glen P. Brockmann in court with attorney Melissa Nepomiachi.  Tracy L. McMiller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion deadline 11-05-15. Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Defendant in court with Atty. M. Nepomiachi. Atty Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Not guilty plea entered. Minutes Filed.
Signed bond filed with the court.

**AMENDMENT 10-05-15: NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH ALYSIA BROCKMAN**
Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH ALYSIA BROCKMANN.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Defendant Glen P. Brockmann appeared, Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
